required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The 10/7 HIIT Shock Cycle Study: Effectiveness of 10 HIIT Sessions in 7 Days
clinical_study.official_title: The 10/7 HIIT Shock Cycle Study: The Effects of a 7-Day High-Intensity-Interval Training Shock Microcycle on Endurance Performance, Well-Being, Stress and Recovery in Endurance Trained Athletes - Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized, controlled trial to evaluate the effects of two versions of 10 high intensity interval trainings (HIIT) within a 7-day shock microcycle on endurance performance, well-being, health, stress and recovery in trained athletes.

detailed_description.textblock: Thirty-six trained endurance athletes will be recruited and randomly assigned to either a "high volume (HIIT-HV)" group, a "low volume (HIIT-LV)" group, or a control group. All participants will be monitored before (9 days), during (7 days), and after (14 days) a 7-day training intervention, for 30 days. Participants in both intervention groups will complete 10 HIIT sessions within the period of 7 days, with an additional 30 minutes of low-intensity training exclusively in HIIT-HV. HIIT sessions consist of aerobic HIIT, i.e., 5x4min at 90-95% of maximal heart rate interspersed by 2.5 min active recovery periods. To determine the effects of the intervention, performance diagnostics, and a 5 kilometer time trial will be conducted before and after the intervention. In addition, participants are closely monitored for general health, stress, fatigue, recovery, neuromuscular performance, executive functions and sleep.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are randomly assigned in either one of 2 intervention groups or a control group (ratio 1:1:1).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 to 21 days (assessment is conducted once before the intervention and repeated three times afterwards, i.e. 3, 7 and 14 days after the completion of the intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Change of maximal oxygen uptake (VO2max in ml/min/kg) compared to baseline and group

primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 to 21 days (assessment is conducted once before the intervention and repeated three times afterwards, i.e. 3, 7 and 14 days after the completion of the intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Change of peak performance (Ppeak in Watt) compared to baseline and group

primary_outcome.time_frame: 20 to 22 days (the assessment is conducted once before, and once after the intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Change of 5 kilometer time trial performance (in sec) compared to baseline and group

primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 to 21 days (assessment is conducted once before the intervention and repeated three times afterwards, i.e. 3, 7 and 14 days after the completion of the intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Change of lactate threshold (in km/h) compared to baseline and group

primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 to 21 days (assessment is conducted once before the intervention and repeated three times afterwards, i.e. 3, 7 and 14 days after the completion of the intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Change of ventilatory thresholds (in km/h) compared to baseline and group

primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 to 21 days (assessment is conducted once before the intervention and repeated three times afterwards, i.e. 3, 7 and 14 days after the completion of the intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Change of running economy (in ml/min/kg) compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (questionnaires will be given to participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of questionnaire scores compared to baseline and group as determined by a Visual-Analogue-Scale (from 0-100 millimeters). Higher scores indicate poorer well-being.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of questionnaire scores - muscular fatigue
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (questionnaires will be given to participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of questionnaire scores compared to baseline and group as determined by a Visual-Analogue-Scale (from 0-100 millimeters). Higher scores indicate higher degree of fatigue.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (questionnaires will be given to participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of questionnaire scores compared to baseline and group as determined by a Likert-Scale (from 0-10). Higher scores indicate higher vitality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of questionnaire scores - rate of fatigue
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (questionnaires will be given to participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of questionnaire scores compared to baseline and group as determined by a Likert-Scale (from 0-10). Higher scores indicate higher degree of fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of questionnaire scores - sleep quality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (questionnaires will be given to participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of questionnaire scores compared to baseline and group as determined by a Likert-Scale (from 1-7). Higher scores indicate poorer sleep.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (blood is drawn from participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of blood count concentrations compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (blood is drawn from participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of cell-free DNA concentrations compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (blood is drawn from participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of creatine kinase concentrations compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (blood is drawn from participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of urea concentrations compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (blood is drawn from participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of blood lactate concentrations compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (blood is drawn from participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of cytokine concentrations compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (blood is drawn from participants several times before, during, and after the intervention.)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of miRNA compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (neuromuscular performance is assessed several times before, during, and after the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of neuromuscular performance (counter movement jump height in cm) measured on a contact plate (AMTI, Watertown, USA) compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 to 21 days (assessment is conducted once before the intervention and repeated three times afterwards, i.e. 3, 7 and 14 days after the completion of the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of body weight in kg compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 to 21 days (assessment is conducted once before the intervention and repeated three times afterwards, i.e. 3, 7 and 14 days after the completion of the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of fat free mass in kg compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 to 21 days (assessment is conducted once before the intervention and repeated three times afterwards, i.e. 3, 7 and 14 days after the completion of the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of fat mass in kg compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 to 21 days (assessment is conducted once before the intervention and repeated three times afterwards, i.e. 3, 7 and 14 days after the completion of the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of forced expiratory volume in liters compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of power output during exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Change of power output in Watt (as determined via Stryd, Boulder, USA) during the intervention compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of sleep quality I - GPS watch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (sleep is assessed several times before, during, and after the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of sleep quality compared to baseline and group as determined by a GPS (Global Positioning System) watch

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of sleep quality II - ABIOS App
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (sleep is assessed several times before, during, and after the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of sleep quality compared to baseline and group as determined by the ABIOS (Algorithmik Biodata System) application

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the correlations between different sleep monitoring devices, i.e. the GPS watch (see outcome 27), the ABIOS system (see outcome 28) and the sleep quality questionnaire (see outcome 11)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of parameters recorded by an electrocardiogram - mean heart rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (an electrocardiogram is written several times before, during, and after the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of mean heart rate compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of parameters recorded by an electrocardiogram - heart rate variability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (an electrocardiogram is written several times before, during, and after the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of heart rate variability (root mean sum of squared distance in ms) compared to baseline and group

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of executive functions - Eriksen flanker task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (executive functions are tested several times before, during, and after the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of executive functions compared to baseline and group. This is recorded through a modified Eriksen flanker task consisting of 108 images showing five white arrows on a black screen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of executive functions - 2 back task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days (executive functions are tested several times before, during, and after the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Change of executive functions compared to baseline and group. This is assessed through a 2-back task showing dots on a dice, numbers and geometrical figures.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day (this outcome will be determined once before study start)
secondary_outcome.description: Description of an athlete cohort regarding cardiac chamber volume (in ml, determined via EPIQ CVX, X5-1, Philips Healthcare, Andover, MA, USA)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Adherence to the HIIT training programs (determined as the ratio of training sessions performed to prescribed training sessions). This is determined by the researchers by checking the training data of the athletes. For example, if 9 out of 10 sessions were performed, this means 90% adherence.

arm_group.description: HIIT-HV - high intensity interval training high volume Participants complete a total of 10 HIIT sessions over a 7-day period consisting of 5 x 4-minute intervals at an intensity of 90-95% of their individual maximum heart rate (HRmax), interspersed with a 2.5-minute active recovery period. Each training session is followed by 30 minutes of low-intensity training (total of 300 minutes of additional low-intensity training during this period).

HIIT- LV - high intensity interval training low volume Participants complete a total of 10 HIIT sessions over a 7-day period consisting of 5 x 4-minute intervals at an intensity of 90-95% of their individual maximum heart rate (HRmax), interspersed with a 2.5-minute active recovery period.
Participants continue with their regular training program.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female or male
- aged 18-50 years
- Proof of physical fitness (e.g. sports medical examination required) for measurements with higher intensities (e.g. endurance tests, competition simulation)
- Competition experience at the national or international level in an endurance sport
- VO2max ≥50ml/kg/min for females; ≥55 ml/kg/min for males
Exclusion Criteria:
- Systemic disease or other known pathology in the organs: heart, lungs, kidney, stomach, spleen, liver, gall bladder, and intestines.
- Evidence of pulmonary disease: forced expiratory volume in one second/forced expiratory volume < 70% with/without symptoms (cough, sputum) or other evidence of pulmonologic disease.
- Diabetes II.
- Neurological or psychological disease of any kind.
- Currently undergoing medical or psycho-therapeutic treatment.
- Health condition that does not allow regular participation in the training forms (e.g. acute illnesses such as fever or other flu-like infections within the last 7 days before the start of the study), orthopedic diseases, injuries to the muscular, bone, joint or tendon apparatus within the last three months.
- Alcohol or drug abuse.
- Already high training volume with high intensity training (more than 2 weekly training sessions of high-intensity training)
